primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God breaks the human systems of control and management through the 'explosive event' of resurrection, moving the world from a state of stagnant 'old math' to a state of 'new life' and 'steadfast love'.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus sees what they are trying to do
God... sent [Moses] into the world to work new freedom
God’s newness is a big, inscrutable leap beyond us

object.identificatie: The New Rule of God / Future / Steadfast Love
tekstueel_bewijs: the coming of the new rule of God that breaks open all of our patterns of control
the narrative-breaking God who makes all things new
We receive from God sustenance for God’s future
We are invited to be the apple of God’s eye

helper.identificatie: The Eucharist / The Psalm / Jesus' Enigmatic Answers
tekstueel_bewijs: When we come to the table... we are nourished
helper.rol_van_geest: External help through the 'sweep of power'

tegenstander.identificatie: The Sadducees / Human Desire for Control / Old Categories
tekstueel_bewijs: our meticulous assumptions and our capacity to control
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a person but the ontological state of human 'mastery' and 'certitude' that resists God's future.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The response of the believer to the new reality: moving from fear to service.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer (The Faithful)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is explicitly framed as a consequence of being 'safe' in God's future.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God’s newness is a big, inscrutable leap beyond us.
God will protect and guard him.
God’s sweep of new life is beyond our categories.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We would like to imagine that the future will be like the past.

voorbeelden: The speaker wants God’s own wondrous covenantal loyalty.
We know that the old categories do not work.
God’s power for life is too large... to be comprehended.
We are free enough... to get on with the new life.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Pouvoir' (Power) of God that overcomes the 'Non-Pouvoir' (Inability) of humans to control the future.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Sadducees' control) to ~S2 (the risk/wits' end of the Psalmist) to S1 (God's fidelity).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'explosive event' of resurrection which renders S2 irrelevant.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; human control is seen as a deadly opposition to God's newness.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is deeply theocentric. God is the primary actor who breaks human systems. Grace is not a 'helper' for human effort but a 'narrative-breaking' power.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The speaker states his own innocence... My steps have held fast.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of the Future
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The future is in the hands of the narrative-breaking God.
We are not fed by bread that we bake... but by bread broken.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Jesus, Moses, Psalmist) are treated as participants in God's action rather than models for human imitation.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: Jesus is the petitioner who falls back on God's love.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is monergistic; God's fidelity is the sole ground of safety.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the Gospel to the Psalm to the Table is logically and actantially consistent.
spanning_punten: The Psalmist's claim of innocence (v. 3-5) sits slightly uncomfortably with the 'broken certitude' theme, but the preacher resolves this by focusing on the 'petition' rather than the 'merit'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Resurrection... blows away all of our meticulous assumptions and our capacity to control.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'sweep of power' functions as the endowment of new life.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is defined as the 'desperate attempt to keep the world the way it was'—a refusal of God's sovereignty.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative program. The hearer is correctly positioned as the Receiver of a future they cannot manage.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Savoir (Knowing the old doesn't work) vs Pouvoir (God's power).
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain the current focus on God's Pouvoir.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Link the 'new life' more explicitly to the indwelling Spirit to move from external power to internal 'Pouvoir-faire'.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Connect 'management' to the 'deadly enemies' of the Psalm more viscerally.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To show that our need for control is not just a 'mistake' but a form of spiritual death.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in avoiding moralism by making the 'newness of God' the primary actant that renders human performance secondary.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'math' metaphor, Greimas reveals that the 'math' is actually the Opponent actant.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the Levirate marriage law; semiotics focuses on the power struggle between human management and divine eruption.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that the 'Table' (Eucharist) functions as a Helper that replaces human 'ovens' (human production).

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Sadducees' as a proxy for the hearer's own resistance to grace.
